headline: Assessing Lowe’s (LOW) Valuation After Barclays Upgrade And Housing Market Optimism
summary: Barclays' decision to raise its rating on Lowe's Companies (LOW) to overweight has refocused attention on the home improvement retailer, as investors weigh potential benefits from an improving housing market and possible pent up demand. See our latest analysis for Lowe's Companies. The latest move comes after a period of relatively steady share price gains, with a 90 day share price return of 5.31% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 2.10%. This suggests only modest momentum despite the...
